I've installed it before on a different machine without trouble.  This time it's just not 
working.  I put it in the /Applications/Utilities/Java folder and that didn't work.  I put 
it in my home directory and that didn't work.  Here's my .tcshrc 
setenv CLASSPATH .:/junit3.8.1/junit.jar

It doesn't work with or without that first slash character.

Here's the first line of 100 errors I get when I try to just compile my tests:

package junit.framework does not exist

This all works fine at the school's lab and on my old machine.

I even tried some of this stuff:

java -cp /Applications/Utilities/Java/junit3.8.1/junit.jar:. junit.swingui.TestRunner 
junit.samples.AllTests

Which gets a junit window but this error message at the bottom:
Class not found "junit.samples.AllTests"

and also this:

Java couldn't paint in Java_apple_awt_CRenderer_doRect, no focused view.

Any help would be appreciated!

-Lido
